intro: Spermacoce juncta, commonly known as the small false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are often clustered in umbels, followed by small, indehiscent fruits known as capsules. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a slightly hairy texture. Spermacoce juncta is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
